comments.author: Mystic.5934
comments.body:
I would absolutely love to see recipe_details for the mystic forge. I want it so much, I went and manually made a bunch of the them. If you want, I could create a text file with all of them in json format, similar to how the recipe_details.json looks.
specifically, I have:
legendaries
gifts
clovers (it uses the average amount of the ingredients it takes)
mystic weapons
the other SP weapons (the ones that use eldritch scroll)
superior siege
Recipe: Box of Armors (I haven’t confirmed them yet, that would take more sp than I have, but theoretically they’re right)
Recipe: Feast of Food / Recipe: Pot of Food / Recipe: Tray of Food (I haven’t confirmed them yet, that would take more sp than I have, but theoretically they’re right)
material promotions (the output_item_count is the average you get)
a few other misc things (like mystic salvage kit and improved experience booster)

782 total recipes

I don’t have everything, such as:
minis
tonics
limited-time recipes (captains council commendations, for example)
all of the “4 rates -> 1 random rare” type recipes

but I do have a simple way of generating them (basically just typing out the names and amounts into a function and it finds the right data_id’s from the database). or what’s also fun is copy/paste a table from the wiki and find/replace

So, if there is interest in this, let me know and I can put it all together and publish what I have. And if there is interest in the parts I don’t have, let me know and I’ll work to complete it (also please provide any resources you have that name what all the recipes are)

comments.body:
Would it be possible to get an official api that offers information about all currently known mystic forge recipes? I would assume it could be a much easier version of the recipe_details api, so to speak. All it would really need would be a corresponding ID, what it produces and what and how many ingredients it uses.

Also, i would like to know if people here would actually find this useful, as i wouldnt mind doing the dirty research work and provide a suitable api of my own for the time being.

Let me know what you guys think about this.
